title: Master ChatGPT: Top 2025 Guide for Realtors
excerpt: Want to master ChatGPT (“GPT”)? We know you’ve heard all about it – OpenAI’s latest machine-learning language model, ChatGPT, has taken the world by storm.…
content:
Want to master ChatGPT (“GPT”)? We know you’ve heard all about it – OpenAI’s latest machine-learning language model, ChatGPT, has taken the world by storm. With its remarkable ability to generate human-like output, it is reshaping the landscape of conversational artificial intelligence. The power to up your productivity is immense!

Gone are the days of stilted and robotic interactions. With the correct skills, you’ll master ChatGPT and bring a new level of sophistication and naturalness to chat-based conversations. And it’s FREE!

ChatGPT can help you reach your full potential as a real estate agent in many ways! Master ChatGPT to unlock a whole realm of possibilities where agents save many hours, create better work products, and, most importantly, stay up with their competition that uses it.

From generating engaging dialogue to providing your digital marketing, this powerful AI tool can transform how real estate agents work. It’s a game-changer in the real estate industry!

Do you have the knowledge to get ChatGPT to provide the results that you seek? It turns out that is no easy task! This blog is going to help you with that and provide corresponding examples to make each point.

Get ready to embark on an exciting journey into the future of real estate agents when you master ChatGPT! Here’s what we’ll cover in this blog:

  • Understanding Generative AI and Prompt Engineering
  • How to Start Using ChatGPT Today
  • Real Estate Agent Examples with Tips, Tricks & Techniques
  • Beware – When ChatGPT is NOT Enough
  • Optimizing for Google Search Engine Ranking
  • Reflecting on Your Journey to Master ChatGPT
  • Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Understanding Generative AI and Prompt Engineering

Exploring the concept of generative AI

Learning to master ChatGPT is easier if you understand something about how it operates. Generative AI, also known as generative artificial intelligence, is a fascinating field that involves creating models capable of content creation.

These models are trained on vast amounts of data and use complex algorithms to produce outputs that resemble a human content writer. In simpler terms, generative AI enables machines to create original text, images, or even music.

It does this by being logical and looking to fill in the answer to “If this, then that”.

Importance of prompt engineering in achieving desired outputs

When working with generative AI models like ChatGPT, great prompts are what it is all about! A prompt is an input given to the model that instructs it on what kind of output to generate. By carefully crafting prompts, we can guide the model towards producing specific responses, basically getting the results that you are seeking.

These “prompts” are referred to as prompt engineering and they involve formulating prompts in a way that elicits the desired information or response from the model. It requires understanding how the model interprets and processes input data.

By providing clear instructions and context through well-designed prompts, we can influence the output generated by the model.

How ChatGPT Generates Responses

ChatGPT processes input data using advanced machine-learning techniques. When ChatGPT receives input, it follows these steps:

  1. Data Interpretation: GPT first interprets the data it receives. This involves understanding the context, the query’s nature, and any specific details or instructions it contains.The model uses its trained neural network to process the text, identifying key elements such as the topic, intent, and any relevant entities.
  2. Data Processing: After interpreting the input, GPT processes it using its underlying AI and machine learning algorithms. This processing involves generating a response that aligns with the input’s context and intent.It’s achieved through a technique known as “transformer-based machine learning,” where the model predicts the next word in a sequence based on the words that come before it.
  3. Response Generation: Finally, GPT generates a relevant response based on its training and the processed data. This step involves selecting the most appropriate words and phrases to construct a coherent and contextually relevant answer.

ChatGPT’s ability to perform these tasks effectively relies on its extensive training in a wide range of data, enabling it to understand and respond to a variety of inputs accurately.

How to Start Using ChatGPT Today

Ok, let’s get into learning the skills needed to master ChatGPT. It only takes a few minutes to start using it. To create a ChatGPT account, follow these steps:

  1. Visit the ChatGPT Website: Go to chat.openai.com.
  2. Sign Up: Click on the “Sign Up” button.
  3. Enter Your Details: On the “Create your account” page, you will be prompted to enter your email address. Alternatively, you can also sign up using a Google or Microsoft account.
  4. Complete the Registration Process: Follow the instructions to complete the registration process, which may include verifying your email address.
  5. Log In: Once your account is created, log in using your chosen credentials (email, Google, or Microsoft account).

After completing these steps, you will have access to ChatGPT and the knowledge to make the most of this machine learning. To make it a little easier to get back to, consider bookmarking your GPT account.

Real Estate Agent Examples with Tips, Tricks & Techniques

Now let’s break ChatGPT down into a nice convenient list. By integrating these techniques into your interactions with ChatGPT, you can harness its full potential while ensuring ethical and effective usage. Here are key practices and examples to master ChatGPT:

Clarity and Specificity:

Be direct and explicit in your prompts. Precise language and specific instructions help the model generate more targeted responses. Avoid ambiguity as ambiguous queries can lead to unintended or undesired responses from ChatGPT.

By giving clear instructions or setting the context at the beginning of the conversation, you can guide the model’s responses effectively. Also, avoid asking broad or vague questions. Be as specific as possible. This helps ChatGPT provide more accurate and relevant responses tailored to your needs.

Example of Clarity and Specificity

Let’s say a real estate agent is seeking to use ChatGPT for writing a property description. The quality and relevance of the output will be better by being clear and specific in their request. Here’s an example of how to frame such a prompt:

“ChatGPT, please write a detailed property description for a listing. The property is a 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom single-family home located at 123 Main Street, Springfield. Key features include a recently renovated kitchen with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances, a spacious living room with a fireplace, hardwood flooring throughout, and a landscaped backyard with a patio. The neighborhood is family-friendly, with easy access to schools, parks, and shopping centers. Highlight these features compellingly and attractively for potential buyers.”

In this prompt, the real estate agent provides specific information about the property, including its type, location, key features, and the surrounding neighborhood. This level of detail enables ChatGPT to generate a more tailored and accurate property description.

Contextual Information:

Include relevant background details to set the scene for your query. Providing context is crucial for obtaining accurate and relevant responses from ChatGPT.

Example of Contextual Information

Let’s say a real estate agent uses contextual information to instruct ChatGPT about crafting a client email about a new property. Here’s an example of how to frame the prompt:

“ChatGPT, I need you to draft an email for one of my clients, Alex Johnson, who is interested in modern, spacious homes in the downtown area. The property is located at 456 Cityview Lane, a prime downtown location. It’s a 4-bedroom, 3-bathroom house with an open floor plan, a large kitchen with state-of-the-art appliances, and a rooftop terrace offering a stunning city view. Alex has a young family and enjoys contemporary design. Please include details that would appeal to them, such as proximity to schools and parks, as well as the home’s modern amenities and spacious layout. The tone should be professional yet friendly, emphasizing how this property aligns with their preferences and lifestyle.”

In this prompt, the agent provides specific details about the client’s preferences, the property, and the desired tone of the email. This allows ChatGPT to create personalized and effective communication tailored to the client’s interests.

Managing Randomness:

Adjust the AI’s temperature settings to balance creativity and predictability in responses. Lower temperatures yield more predictable results, while higher settings increase randomness.

Example of Managing Randomness

To manage randomness when requesting ChatGPT to write an Instagram post about the benefits of homeownership over renting, a real estate agent can provide specific guidance on the content creation and tone of the post. Here’s an example prompt:

“ChatGPT, I need an engaging Instagram post for potential homebuyers. The post should focus on the advantages of owning a home compared to renting. Please include points on building equity, the freedom to customize the property, and potential tax benefits. Aim for a positive and motivating tone, suitable for a broad audience. Include a call to action encouraging followers to reach out for more information on homeownership. Avoid overly technical language and keep the post concise and relatable.”

This prompt is specific about the content (benefits of homeownership), the tone (positive and motivating), the audience (broad), and the structure (including a call-to-action). By providing these details, the agent can reduce the randomness in ChatGPT’s response and ensure the post aligns with their marketing goals.

Experiment with Prompts:

Utilize different prompts to get the desired output from ChatGPT. Experimentation helps you understand how the model responds to different inputs and prompts.

Example of Experimenting with Prompts

Real estate agents can use various prompts to request a motivation statement from ChatGPT. Each prompt can lead to different responses based on its specificity and context. Here are some examples:

  1. General Prompt: “ChatGPT, can you provide a general motivation statement for a real estate agent to stay focused and driven in their career?”
  2. Client-Centric Prompt: “ChatGPT, create a motivation statement emphasizing the importance of client satisfaction in real estate.”
  3. Market Challenges Prompt: “ChatGPT, write a motivation statement for a real estate agent facing a challenging market, highlighting resilience and adaptability.”
  4. Goal-Oriented Prompt: “ChatGPT, draft a motivation statement for a real estate agent aiming to double their sales this year.”
  5. Innovation and Growth Prompt: “ChatGPT, I need a motivation statement for my website that inspires a real estate agent to embrace new technologies and growth opportunities in the industry.”
  6. Work-Life Balance Prompt: “ChatGPT, please write a motivation statement for real estate agents focusing on maintaining a healthy work-life balance.”

Each prompt directs ChatGPT to generate a motivation statement tailored to different aspects of a real estate agent’s career, be it client relationships, market challenges, personal goals, embracing change, or balancing work and life.

Experiment with Prompt Length:

Experiment with the length of your prompts. Different lengths can influence the model’s response, offering varied depth and breadth of information.

Example of Experimenting with Prompt Length

Using the same desire for a motivational statement as in the last example, a real estate agent can use prompts of different lengths to elicit varied responses from ChatGPT.

  1. Short Prompt: “ChatGPT, give me a quick motivation boost for real estate sales.”Result: A concise, general motivational statement suitable for quick inspiration.
  2. Medium-Length Prompt: “ChatGPT, I need a motivational statement about persisting in real estate during slow markets.”Result: A more focused motivational statement addressing the specific challenge of slow markets.
  3. Long Prompt: “ChatGPT, as a real estate agent focusing on luxury properties in a competitive market, I often face high expectations and intense competition. Can you provide a detailed motivational statement that reminds me of the importance of personal branding and networking in maintaining a successful career in this niche?”Result: A detailed and nuanced motivational statement tailored to the challenges of selling luxury properties and the importance of personal branding and networking.

Each prompt length allows for different levels of specificity and detail in the response, giving the agent flexibility in how they want to be motivated.

Engage in Back-and-Forth:

To obtain more detailed and comprehensive answers, engage in back-and-forth conversations with ChatGPT. This iterative dialogue of refining your prompts and instructions based on previous responses from ChatGPT allows you to fine-tune your queries and obtain better results over time.

Example of Back-and-Forth Dialogue

A real estate agent can engage in a back-and-forth dialogue with ChatGPT to develop a comprehensive script for asking a client to lower the price of their home. Here’s an example of how this dialogue might unfold:

  1. Agent’s Initial Request: “ChatGPT, I need to write a script to gently ask a client to consider lowering the price of their home. Can you start with a basic outline?”
  2. ChatGPT’s Response: ChatGPT provides a basic script outline focusing on key points like market trends, the importance of competitive pricing, and the benefits of attracting more buyers.
  3. Agent’s Follow-Up: “That’s a good start, but can you include some empathetic language that acknowledges the client’s attachment to their home?”
  4. ChatGPT’s Revised Response: ChatGPT updates the script, adding empathetic statements and addressing the emotional aspects of selling a home.
  5. Agent’s Further Request: “Can you now add a section explaining how a price reduction could lead to a faster sale, using recent market statistics?”
  6. ChatGPT’s Addition: ChatGPT adds a section with simplified market statistics and examples showing how competitive pricing can speed up the sale process.
  7. Final Agent Request: “Great, now please conclude with a reassuring statement that highlights my commitment to getting the best possible outcome for them.”
  8. ChatGPT’s Final Touch: ChatGPT concludes the script with a reassuring closing that emphasizes the agent’s dedication to the client’s interests and the successful sale of the property.

Through this iterative dialogue, the agent can refine the script to be comprehensive, empathetic, informative, and persuasive.

Use Warm-Up Prompts

Begin your conversation by providing warm-up prompts that help set expectations for both yourself and ChatGPT. This allows the model to understand what kind of information or assistance you are seeking.

Example of Using Warm-Up Prompts

Let’s see how real estate agents can use warm-up prompts to master ChatGPT to create a catchy flyer for an open house. Here’s an example of how to use these prompts:

  1. Initial Prompt: “ChatGPT, I’m planning an open house for a property in a residential neighborhood and need to create a flyer. Can we start with some ideas on how to make the flyer inviting and attention-grabbing?”
  2. Building on the Response: After ChatGPT’s initial ideas, the agent can follow up with, “Great suggestions! Now, can you focus on emphasizing the unique features of the home, like the newly renovated kitchen and spacious backyard?”
  3. Refining Details: “Based on your ideas, let’s add details about the open house event. Include the date, time, and a friendly message encouraging neighbors to visit. Maybe something like ‘Meet your potential new neighbors and explore this beautiful home!’”
  4. Finalizing the Output: “Now that we have the content, can you format it into a brief but engaging flyer layout, suitable for printing and distribution in the neighborhood?”

Through this step-by-step process, the agent sets clear expectations and gradually builds up to a comprehensive and effective flyer design.

Controlled Output:

If you want more control over the output, consider using system-level instructions such as “You are a helpful assistant” or “You are an expert in [specific topic].” These instructions can guide the behavior of ChatGPT in a particular direction.

Example of Using Controlled Outputs

A real estate agent wanting ChatGPT to provide 5 great YouTube ideas might say, “ChatGPT, you are an expert in knowing the best YouTube topics for a real estate agent. Can you provide me with 5 engaging and informative video topics that I should consider for my YouTube channel?

That might return: 1. Home Buying Process Explained: Break down the steps of buying a home for first-time buyers 2. Virtual Property Tours: Showcase property listings with virtual tours. 3. Market Trends and Analysis: Discuss current real estate market trends and what they mean for buyers and sellers. 4. Home Staging Tips: Offer advice on how to stage homes for sale. 5. Neighborhood Guides: Highlight the best features of local neighborhoods.

By using system-level instructions, the agent guides ChatGPT to focus on creating a list of YouTube topics specifically beneficial for real estate professionals.

Breaking Down Complexities:

If you have a complex question, consider breaking it down into smaller, simpler parts. This makes it easier for ChatGPT to understand and respond effectively.

Example of Breaking Down Complexities

A real estate agent may have a complex question like, “How do I increase my real estate sales in a competitive market, enhance my online presence, and improve client satisfaction?” This question can be broken down into smaller, simpler parts for more effective responses from ChatGPT:

  1. Increasing Sales: “ChatGPT, what are effective strategies for increasing real estate sales in a competitive market?”
  2. Enhancing Online Presence: “Based on the current digital marketing trends, what are the best methods for a real estate agent to enhance their online presence?”
  3. Improving Client Satisfaction: “Can you provide tips on improving client satisfaction during the real estate buying and selling process?”

By dividing the complex question into these distinct parts, the agent can obtain more targeted and practical advice for each aspect of their query.

Feedback Contribution:

Provide feedback on the model’s outputs. Your input helps to improve ChatGPT’s accuracy and effectiveness.

Example of a Feedback Contribution:

A real estate agent can enhance ChatGPT’s accuracy and effectiveness by providing specific feedback on its responses. Here’s an example:

Scenario: ChatGPT generates a property description for a listing.

ChatGPT’s Response: “This charming 3-bedroom home features a spacious backyard and a modern kitchen.”

Agent’s Feedback: “The description is good, but it needs to be more detailed for potential buyers. Can you include specific features such as the type of countertops in the kitchen, the size of the backyard in square feet, and any recent renovations? Also, please mention the proximity to local amenities like schools and parks.”

By giving detailed feedback, the agent guides ChatGPT to produce more tailored and informative content, improving its utility for real estate purposes.

Beware – When Artificial Intelligence is NOT Enough

Now that you’re getting a handle on how to talk to ChatGPT, you need to beware of its negatives. While ChatGPT has immense potential, it’s important to use it responsibly and ethically. Here are some considerations:

  1. Be Mindful of Biases: Like any language model trained on vast amounts of information from the internet, ChatGPT may exhibit biases present in that information. Be aware of this possibility and critically evaluate the responses for fairness and accuracy.
  2. Verify Information Independently: While ChatGPT can provide helpful information, always verify critical facts independently from reliable sources before relying solely on its responses.
  3. Avoid Misuse or Harmful Output: Use ChatGPT responsibly by refraining from harmful content creation or engaging in activities that violate OpenAI’s usage policies.
  4. Respect Boundaries: Remember that ChatGPT is an AI language model and not a human being. Respect its limitations and boundaries when interacting with it, just as you would with any other technology tool.

Reflecting on Your Journey to Master ChatGPT

Congratulations on discovering how artificial intelligence and ChatGPT can revolutionize your business. This AI tool is a game-changer, boosting your productivity. When you master ChatGPT, you have a content writer, quickly able to create guides, property descriptions, digital marketing, video description help, improve your website, and personalized marketing content, like having a 24/7 in-house assistant who likes ups your branding.

The growth potential is immense. Integrate ChatGPT into your toolkit, experiment, refine your skills, and see tangible improvements. In a competitive market, ChatGPT is your secret weapon for better work, streamlined tasks, and real estate success. Start now and embrace ChatGPT’s power to propel your career to new heights!

Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Join the leading force in real estate with eXp Realty – the only profitable publicly traded brokerage over the past five years and holds the prestigious title of the best brokerage to work for. The benefits of eXp Realty are unmatched and will truly exceed your expectations!

When you join us at Smart Agent Alliance, you’ll also be part of the Wolf Pack at eXp Realty.  Together we are one big team and we provide more FREE value than you’ll get anywhere else in the real estate business.

What’s included? Access our exclusive SAA Vault Assets to enhance your business efficiency, attend weekly team video calls filled with invaluable insights and top agent strategies, and receive the Social Agent Academy Program and Investor Army Courses – a combined value of over $1,500 – absolutely free. And that’s just the beginning! Explore more about our robust team benefits.

Don’t let this opportunity pass you by. Transform your real estate career, maximize your income, and secure your future. Contact us now to schedule a video consultation or email us at team@SmartAgentAlliance.com. We’re here to ensure your success.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Is ChatGPT free?

Yes, although OpenAi does offer a paid version with some upgrades for the user experience, anyone can use ChatGPT for free. So start to master CHatGPT today!

Can I publish what ChatGPT generates as my own?

Under the guidelines provided by OpenAI, individuals are permitted to recreate what was produced in interactions with ChatGPT. Nonetheless, it’s crucial to recognize that distributing content derived from ChatGPT can lead to legal challenges, including potential breaches of copyright laws. Therefore, users should consider the outputs from ChatGPT primarily as creative inspiration rather than direct content for publication.

Can I use ChatGPT for customer support?

Absolutely! ChatGPT can be a valuable tool for providing customer support. With its ability to generate human-like responses, you can train it to handle common customer queries and provide accurate information in real-time, totally improving your productivity! Just make sure to monitor its responses closely and fine-tune it regularly to ensure it aligns with your brand’s tone of voice.

Is there a limit to the length of conversations I can have with ChatGPT?

While there is no strict limit on conversation length with ChatGPT, it’s important to note that very long conversations may lead to less coherent responses. To maintain clarity and coherence in the generated output, consider breaking down lengthy conversations into smaller chunks or using concise prompts.

Can I use ChatGPT as a content writer?

Certainly! ChatGPT can be an excellent tool for content creation. Whether you need help brainstorming ideas or generating drafts for articles or blog posts, it can assist you by providing creative suggestions or even complete paragraphs. However, always remember that human input and editing are crucial to ensure the final content meets your specific needs and aligns with your branding.

How can I address biases in ChatGPT’s responses?

While OpenAI has made efforts to mitigate biases in ChatGPT, it may still occasionally produce biased or inaccurate responses. To address this, you can provide explicit instructions to avoid certain types of bias or review and edit its outputs carefully. OpenAI also encourages users to provide feedback on problematic model outputs through their user interface.

Can I use ChatGPT for generating code or technical documentation?

Certainly! ChatGPT can be a valuable resource for generating code snippets or assisting with technical documentation. However, keep in mind that it is not a substitute for professional developers or technical writers. Always review and test the generated code or documentation thoroughly before implementing it in production environments.

Is there an API limit on the number of requests I can make to ChatGPT?

Yes, there are API limits based on your subscription plan. Free trial users have lower rate limits compared to pay-as-you-go users. You can find detailed information about rate limits and pricing on the OpenAI website. Make sure to manage your usage accordingly and consider upgrading if you require higher request volumes.

How often is ChatGPT updated?

OpenAI continually works on improving its models, including ChatGPT, by incorporating user feedback and conducting regular updates. As a result, you can expect ongoing enhancements and refinements over time. Stay tuned for announcements from OpenAI regarding new features and improvements as they continue to evolve their language models.

How Does OpenAi Improve the User Experience?

Provide Feedback: OpenAI encourages users to provide feedback on problematic model outputs through the user interface. By providing feedback, you contribute to improving the system’s performance and addressing any limitations or biases that may arise.

Will Google search punish me by ranking me lower if I use ChatGPT to write my content?

The answer appears to be unknown at this time. Google states in its SEO policies that the content’s value is most important. However, others claim that Google does punish ChatGPT output. If you want to protect yourself from that problem, consider using one of the many AI detection sites to check whether Google is likely to recognize your content as AI-written.

title: eXp Realty for New Agents: A Smart Move in 2025?
excerpt: Are you a brand new agent looking for the best brokerage to join? As a UC Berkeley Law School graduate and past California lawyer, I…
content:
Are you a brand new agent looking for the best brokerage to join? As a UC Berkeley Law School graduate and past California lawyer, I suspected the decision regarding which brokerage a new agent should join would be huge. It is!

After all, the National Association of Realtors reported that 75% of Realtors fail within the first year, and 87% fail within five years. Researching brokerage options is worth a brand-new agent’s time.

I researched several brokerages. I researched eXp Realty because it’s the fastest-growing brokerage in U.S. history and on the planet. It’s also now a part of the S&P 600. I also researched other traditional brokerages – Compass, Vanguard, Sotheby’s, Coldwell Banker, and Remax – because of their local presence.

In this article, I’ll share everything I learned from my research and interviews, plus, I’ll share everything I’ve learned since I joined eXp Realty, the pros of being at eXp and the cons of the brokerage, particularly for new agents.

While eXp is the right brokerage for many brokers, real estate teams, seasoned/experienced agents, and new agents, eXp Realty is not right for every agent. Fortunately, it is for me. By my second year at eXp, I did well over 6 figures in gross commission. I LOVE my brokerage, my eXp sponsorship group, and community, and what I do. But is eXp the best brokerage for you?

New Agents, How is eXp Realty Different?
Pros of Joining eXp Realty for New Agents

1. 100% Commission Payout Possibility
2. Extensive FREE Agent Training
3. Low Agent Fees and Costs
4. Superior Support with eXp World & Mentors
5. Seven-Tier Sponsorship Groups Can Provide Top Value
6. Innovative Technology and Virtual Tools
7. Access to Huge Network of Experienced Agents Across Different Markets
8. Work from Anywhere, Anytime with Virtual Support Systems
9. Brand New Agents Can Be More Efficient with New Tech tools
10. Affordable Healthcare
11. eXp Luxury Launched
12. eXp Centralized a Referral Division
13. eXp Commercial Real Estate Division
14. eXp has Extensive Vendor Partners
Cons of Joining eXp Realty for New Agents

2. Revenue Share Challenges for New Agents
3. Lack of On-Site Broker Guidance May be Hard for New Agents
4. Almost Too Much Support and Training for New Agents
5. Lead Generation – New Agents Need to Learn How
Tips for New Agents to Succeed at eXp Realty

1. Research & Choose the Right Sponsorship Group
2. Embrace Additional Value Offered by eXp
3. Leverage Modern Marketing Strategies
4. Seek Guidance from Experienced Mentors
5. Utilize eXp World for Support
Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty
FAQs

New Agents, How is eXp Realty Different?

eXp Realty is primarily different than most brokerages because it’s a cloud-based brokerage that relies on modern technology to operate in a more effective, efficient, and profitable manner. Traditional brick-and-mortar brokerages don’t run as efficiently because of their high cost of maintaining local office space and many layers of franchise owners.

eXp Realty is the only large brokerage that earned a net profit in 2022, a year of falling transactions in the real estate industry. eXp can afford to improve agent earnings while other brokerages decrease what agents earn. Also, eXp Realty has been on Glassdoor’s best companies to work at for the last 6 years.

Let’s dive into the pros and cons of joining eXp Realty for new brand agents.

Pros of Joining eXp Realty for New Agents

1. 100% Commission Payout Possibility

Traditional brokerages told me new agents get anywhere from a 70/30 payout split to a 60/40 payout split (actually 64/36 and 54/44 because they didn’t deduct their 6% fee.)

eXp Realty’s payout split can be more than 100% of an agent’s commissions. All agents start with an 80/20 split (a real one, there’s no hidden 6% broker fee). One exception – brand new agents earn 60/40 for their first 3 transactions while they are in eXp’s mentorship program (more on the mentorship program below).

Once an agent pays eXp $16,000 from their earned commissions (about $2.65 million in gross sales at 3% commission), the agent is considered “capped” that year and then the agent earns 100% of their commissions for the rest of their calendar year.

2. Extensive FREE Agent Training

New agents at traditional brokerages often rely on one broker in their office to answer all their questions. A broker told me that I should buy expensive ($2000 or more) training classes to “learn” how to get leads and clients and make a commission.

eXp’s training extends well beyond the support offered by a single broker. eXp has 3 primary training opportunities: 1. On-boarding videos and webinars directed at helping new agents get leads, clients, and commission as fast as possible, 2. 60+ hours of live training classes available each week, and those same training classes are recorded and available on-demand if a new agent can’t make the live training. 3. Sponsorship groups incentivized to offer additional training classes to agents. These sponsorship groups run 7 tiers deep, creating a deep support system for new agents.

3. Low Agent Fees and Costs

Traditional brokerages have so many fees: a 6% fee paid from gross commission on each transaction; a fee of $2000+ for E&O insurance due at the beginning of each year; $100s in monthly desk fees and/or franchise fees. Also, at most traditional brokerages, agents must purchase their website and CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tool.

eXp Realty has no desk fees, no franchise fees, and no royalty fees. New agents pay $149 their first month at eXp and then just $85 a month thereafter. Additionally, that low monthly fee includes a personalized IDX website, a top industry CRM with lead generation tools (one that other agents pay $6000 a year for), access to Regus Business Lounges (yep, eXp does have office space), ongoing live training, and much more.

Also, at eXp E&O insurance fees are much lower – $40 paid from each commission and it caps at $500 annually. Last, eXp agents pay $25 for broker review from each commission. Clearly, eXp fees are MUCH lower than traditional brokerage fees!

4. Superior Support with eXp World & Mentors

To get new agent questions answered, traditional brokerages told me “go to your office broker to ask your questions”. Wow, agents have to rely on the knowledge and availability of just one person?

eXp Realty has over 2000 salaried employees in eXp World (their cloud-based office) to help answer questions and solve problems. Some employees are available 24-7.

Additionally, eXp Realty has a mentorship program for brand-new agents. New agents are assigned a mentor who has been qualified by eXp. These mentors are invaluable in a new agent’s day-to-day needs and guidance through transactions.

5. Seven-Tier Sponsorship Groups Can Provide Top Value

eXp Realty’s has unique 7-tier sponsorship groups that set it apart from other real estate brokerages. These groups offer agents incredible advantages in 2 ways.

First, agents earn revenue income by sponsoring other agents into the company, something all agents do at any brokerage company, yet, at eXp, agents are compensated (from the company dollar). This revenue share income is nothing to sneeze at. Top agents at eXp earn over 7 figures a month. That is not a typo! This revenue share income continues when an agent retires and it’s willable too.

Second, because sponsorship groups only profit when agents earn commissions (sponsors are paid from the 20% eXp makes before an agent caps), sponsors are incentivized to help agents succeed both in their production and in bringing in new agents to the company.

Great sponsorship groups offer training, support, and several weekly video calls that help agents earn more commissions and revenue share income. These calls also create community. Many agents say their virtual community is tighter than any physical brokerage office they’ve ever worked in.

6. Innovative Technology and Virtual Tools

In today’s digital age, having access to innovative technology and virtual tools is essential for success in real estate. eXp Realty offers cutting-edge tools and training that are expanding all the time.

Currently, eXp Realty has eXp World, IDX websites, Skyslope to easily complete transactions, a CRM that includes lead generation tools, a marketing center with customizable marketing materials, and so much more.

7. Access to Huge Network of Experienced Agents Across Different Markets

eXp Realty’s huge network of over 88,000 agents offers invaluable opportunities for learning, collaboration, and referrals. That along with eXp’s culture of sharing allows new agents to connect with experienced agents to tap into their training expertise and gain valuable insights to navigate challenges and earn more commissions.

8. Work from Anywhere, Anytime with Virtual Support Systems

eXp Realty’s virtual work environment provides the flexibility to work from anywhere at any time. No eXp agent is confined by traditional office hours or geographic limitations. eXp Realty’s virtual support systems ensure agents have all the tools and resources needed for digital-age success.

9. Brand New Agents Can Be More Efficient with New Tech tools

eXp has many advanced technology tools that other brokerages don’t have. Brand new agents are even more poised to take advantage of these tools than experienced agents who leave another brokerage and join eXp. That’s because experienced agents tend to keep doing what they were doing before they joined eXp and often they don’t learn to use the more efficient and effective tools that eXp offers. Brand new agents often make better use of Skyslope forms, kvCore CRM, kvCore Comparative Market Analysis, and so much more.

10. Affordable Healthcare

Although healthcare is not free at eXp, most brokerages have no healthcare options. eXp Realty offers affordable healthcare options saving agents up to tens of thousands of dollars annually in healthcare costs.

11. eXp Luxury Launched

Sothebys, The Agency, and Compass no longer have the best marketing. eXp Luxury advertises luxury homes in the best of the best publications, translates listings into different languages, and offers global exposure for luxury listings. Plus, members of eXp Luxury get 4 monthly training calls offering top tips and training classes for our luxury agents.

12. eXp Centralized a Referral Division

With over 88,000+ agents all around the world, referrals are BIG business. eXp has made referrals easy with a centralized hub. A few clicks on a form and referral paperwork is all done. For agents choosing to only provide referrals to earn commissions, eXp has made it so those agents no longer have to pay their MLS and Realtor association fees.

13. eXp Commercial Real Estate Division

That’s right! Commercial agents get all the same great features and benefits that eXp offers. At eXp Realty, agents have lots of choices of how to earn an income.

14. eXp has Extensive Vendor Partners

While sponsors often use the term “partner with me”, vendor partners refers to the vendors that eXp Realty has relationships with that bring services to eXp agents. The sheer size of eXp Realty with over 88,000 agents worldwide provides bargaining power for eXp to bring the best to agents.

Cons of Joining eXp Realty for New Agents

1. Missed Opportunity When New Agent Chooses the “Wrong” Sponsor

Some agents join eXp Realty without naming a sponsor and others join sponsorship groups that don’t provide the value needed for that agent. It’s important for new agents to research the sponsorship groups so they won’t miss out on training, support, guidance, or resources that could have helped them thrive in their real estate careers.

Note, that agents can not easily change sponsorship groups. To change groups, an agent must leave eXp for at least 6 months and then rejoin the company.

2. Revenue Share Challenges for New Agents

Some agents become discouraged when trying to bring more agents into eXp and they may struggle to build income through attracting recruits. Joining a sponsorship group with revenue share training brings more success to agents seeking revenue share this income.

3. Lack of On-Site Broker Guidance May be Hard for New Agents

eXp Realty doesn’t maintain traditional brick-and-mortar offices. While the flexibility to work anytime from anywhere appeals to many agents, it may not suit everyone’s preferences or needs.

Working remotely requires a high level of self-motivation and discipline, especially when it comes to training and doing the day-to-day activities necessary to succeed in the real estate business. While some agents thrive in this setting, others may struggle to stay focused and productive without the structure of a traditional office environment.

4. Almost Too Much Support and Training for New Agents

Navigating the complexities of eXp Realty’s support, training classes, tools, and resources can be overwhelming. If a new agent joins eXp with a sponsor who doesn’t help an agent navigate it all, the agent may feel lost and unsure about what steps to take next in their training.

5. Lead Generation – New Agents Need to Learn How

eXp Realty is not going to hand agents leads. However, eXp will teach agents how to get them. “Give a man a fish and he eats for a day; teach him to fish and he eats for a lifetime.”

eXp will help agents get leads. First, eXp has a relationship with OpCity (Realtor.com). New agents can get solid leads by just being the first one to claim a lead. Second, eXp has a program called “Make it Rain”, essentially a pay-for-click program completely done for agents to get leads. Additionally, eXp’s CRM creates the ability for agents to make landing pages and squeeze pages to find leads. Also, many sponsorship groups teach agents more ways to generate leads. Last, new agents learn how to generate leads in eXp’s Fast Start Training Series Program.

Some traditional brokerages claim that leads will be given to new agents. It’s a common complaint that many brokerages don’t fulfill that promise or they do it with stale (bad) leads. Agents that join a brokerage only because they hand out leads, are not running their businesses. They are working for someone else.

It’s crucial to evaluate potential sponsorship groups. Each group has its own unique culture, support system, and resources that can greatly impact your success. Look for a group that aligns with your values and goals.

At eXp Realty, new agents can access additional value beyond traditional real estate brokerage services. Take full advantage. eXp University provides comprehensive training resources. Utilize it by checking the weekly course and attending the courses that suit your needs.

3. Leverage Modern Marketing Strategies

In today’s digital age, having a strong online presence is essential for any real estate agent to build their brand and attract clients. When selecting a sponsorship group, prioritize those offering modern marketing strategy training.

4. Seek Guidance from Experienced Mentors

New agents at eXp are assigned a mentor for the agent’s first 3 transactions. Mentors offer advice and direction on lead generation, negotiation tactics, and market trends, as well as transactions. Actively engage with them, ask questions, and soak up their wisdom to enhance your chances of success.

5. Utilize eXp World for Support

eXp World is an immersive virtual platform that allows agents to connect with colleagues worldwide and to get questions answered and problems solved. Take a tour of eXp World. Go to your state brokerage for production issues, go to tech help for any tech issues, and go to agent support for questions surrounding onboarding. Visit the self-help areas and visit the eXp partner booths. Take advantage of the over 2000 salaried employees in eXp World who are waiting to be of service to you.
